001// Copyright (c) Choreo contributors
002
003package choreo.auto;
004
005import static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Alert.AlertType.kWarning;
006
007import choreo.Choreo;
008import choreo.trajectory.Trajectory;
009import choreo.trajectory.TrajectorySample;
010import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.DriverStation;
011import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.event.EventLoop;
012import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command;
013import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandScheduler;
014import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Commands;
015import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.button.Trigger;
016import java.util.function.BooleanSupplier;
017
018/**
019 * An object that represents an autonomous routine.
020 *
021 * <p>This loop is used to handle autonomous trigger logic and schedule commands. This loop should
022 * **not** be shared across multiple autonomous routines.
023 *
024 * @see AutoFactory#newRoutine Creating a routine from a AutoFactory
025 */
026public class AutoRoutine {
027  /**
028   * The factory that created this loop. This is used to create commands that are associated with
029   * this loop.
030   */
031  protected final AutoFactory factory;
032
033  /** The underlying {@link EventLoop} that triggers are bound to and polled */
034  protected final EventLoop loop;
035
036  /** The name of the auto routine this loop is associated with */
037  protected final String name;
038
039  /** A boolean utilized in {@link #running()} to resolve trueness */
040  protected boolean isActive = false;
041
042  /** A boolean that is true when the loop is killed */
043  protected boolean isKilled = false;
044
045  /** The amount of times the routine has been polled */
046  protected int pollCount = 0;
047
048  /** Returns true if the alliance is known or is irrelevant (i.e. flipping is not being done) */
049  protected BooleanSupplier allianceKnownOrIgnored = () -> true;
050
051  /**
052   * A constructor to be used when inhereting this class to instantiate a custom inner loop
053   *
054   * @param factory The factory that created this loop
055   * @param name The name of the loop
056   * @param loop The inner {@link EventLoop}
057   */
058  protected AutoRoutine(AutoFactory factory, String name, EventLoop loop) {
059    this.factory = factory;
060    this.loop = loop;
061    this.name = name;
062  }
063
064  /**
065   * Creates a new loop with a specific name
066   *
067   * @param factory The factory that created this loop
068   * @param name The name of the loop
069   * @see AutoFactory#newRoutine Creating a loop from a AutoFactory
070   */
071  protected AutoRoutine(AutoFactory factory, String name) {
072    this(factory, name, new EventLoop());
073  }
074
075  /**
076   * Creates a new loop with a specific name and a custom alliance supplier.
077   *
078   * @param factory The factory that created this loop
079   * @param name The name of the loop
080   * @param allianceKnownOrIgnored Returns true if the alliance is known or is irrelevant (i.e.
081   *     flipping is not being done).
082   * @see AutoFactory#newRoutine Creating a loop from a AutoFactory
083   */
084  protected AutoRoutine(AutoFactory factory, String name, BooleanSupplier allianceKnownOrIgnored) {
085    this(factory, name);
086    this.allianceKnownOrIgnored = allianceKnownOrIgnored;
087  }
088
089  /**
090   * Returns a {@link Trigger} that is true while this autonomous routine is being polled.
091   *
092   * <p>Using a {@link Trigger#onFalse(Command)} will do nothing as when this is false the routine
093   * is not being polled anymore.
094   *
095   * @return A {@link Trigger} that is true while this autonomous routine is being polled.
096   */
097  public Trigger running() {
098    return new Trigger(loop, () -> isActive && DriverStation.isAutonomousEnabled());
099  }
100
101  /** Polls the routine. Should be called in the autonomous periodic method. */
102  public void poll() {
103    if (!DriverStation.isAutonomousEnabled()
104        || !allianceKnownOrIgnored.getAsBoolean()
105        || isKilled) {
106      isActive = false;
107      return;
108    }
109    pollCount++;
110    loop.poll();
111    isActive = true;
112  }
113
114  /**
115   * Gets the event loop that this routine is using.
116   *
117   * @return The event loop that this routine is using.
118   */
119  public EventLoop loop() {
120    return loop;
121  }
122
123  /**
124   * Creates a {@link Trigger} that is bound to the routine's {@link EventLoop}.
125   *
126   * @param condition The condition represented by the trigger.
127   * @return A {@link Trigger} that mirrors the state of the provided {@code condition}
128   */
129  public Trigger observe(BooleanSupplier condition) {
130    return new Trigger(loop, condition);
131  }
132
133  /**
134   * Gets the poll count of the routine.
135   *
136   * @return The poll count of the routine.
137   */
138  int pollCount() {
139    return pollCount;
140  }
141
142  /**
143   * Resets the routine. This can either be called on auto init or auto end to reset the routine
144   * incase you run it again. If this is called on a routine that doesn't need to be reset it will
145   * do nothing.
146   */
147  public void reset() {
148    pollCount = 0;
149    isActive = false;
150  }
151
152  /** Kills the loop and prevents it from running again. */
153  public void kill() {
154    CommandScheduler.getInstance().cancelAll();
155    if (isKilled) {
156      return;
157    }
158    reset();
159    Choreo.alert("Killed an auto loop", kWarning).set(true);
160    isKilled = true;
161  }
162
163  /**
164   * Creates a new {@link AutoTrajectory} to be used in an auto routine.
165   *
166   * @param trajectoryName The name of the trajectory to use.
167   * @return A new {@link AutoTrajectory}.
168   */
169  public AutoTrajectory trajectory(String trajectoryName) {
170    return factory.trajectory(trajectoryName, this);
171  }
172
173  /**
174   * Creates a new {@link AutoTrajectory} to be used in an auto routine.
175   *
176   * @param trajectoryName The name of the trajectory to use.
177   * @param splitIndex The index of the split trajectory to use.
178   * @return A new {@link AutoTrajectory}.
179   */
180  public AutoTrajectory trajectory(String trajectoryName, final int splitIndex) {
181    return factory.trajectory(trajectoryName, splitIndex, this);
182  }
183
184  /**
185   * Creates a new {@link AutoTrajectory} to be used in an auto routine.
186   *
187   * @param <SampleType> The type of the trajectory samples.
188   * @param trajectory The trajectory to use.
189   * @return A new {@link AutoTrajectory}.
190   */
191  public <SampleType extends TrajectorySample<SampleType>> AutoTrajectory trajectory(
192      Trajectory<SampleType> trajectory) {
193    return factory.trajectory(trajectory, this);
194  }
195
196  /**
197   * Creates a command that will poll this event loop and reset it when it is cancelled.
198   *
199   * <p>The command will end instantly and kill the routine if the alliance supplier returns an
200   * empty optional when the command is scheduled.
201   *
202   * @return A command that will poll this event loop and reset it when it is cancelled.
203   * @see #cmd(BooleanSupplier) A version of this method that takes a condition to finish the loop.
204   */
205  public Command cmd() {
206    return cmd(() -> false);
207  }
208
209  /**
210   * Creates a command that will poll this event loop and reset it when it is finished or canceled.
211   *
212   * <p>The command will end instantly and kill the routine if the alliance supplier returns an
213   * empty optional when the command is scheduled.
214   *
215   * @param finishCondition A condition that will finish the loop when it is true.
216   * @return A command that will poll this event loop and reset it when it is finished or canceled.
217   * @see #cmd() A version of this method that doesn't take a condition and never finishes except if
218   *     the alliance supplier returns an empty optional when scheduled.
219   */
220  public Command cmd(BooleanSupplier finishCondition) {
221    return Commands.either(
222        Commands.run(this::poll)
223            .finallyDo(this::reset)
224            .until(() -> !DriverStation.isAutonomousEnabled() || finishCondition.getAsBoolean())
225            .withName(name),
226        Commands.runOnce(
227            () -> {
228              Choreo.alert("Alliance not known when starting routine", kWarning).set(true);
229              kill();
230            }),
231        allianceKnownOrIgnored);
232  }
233}
